pull.title: test: Add test for sendall min-fee setting
pull.body:
While experimenting with mutation testing it appeared that the minimum fee-rate check was not tested for the `sendall` RPC.
 
https://bcm-ui.aureleoules.com/mutations/3581479318544ea6b97f788cec6e6ef1

events.body:

rename.from: test(sendall): Add test for min-fee setting
rename.to: test: Add test for sendall min-fee setting

events.body: Concept ACK, but any reason not to put this in `wallet_sendall.py`?

> Concept ACK, but any reason not to put this in wallet_sendall.py?

You're right it makes more sense. Updated.

verification.payload:
tree 84f51bfe6fde664823edfd00d8463ed6da773d78
parent 02515117dc5a25998f5dd92938eccb326b1eec5c
author Aurèle Oulès <aurele@oules.com> 1669922758 +0100

test: Add sendall test for min-fee setting

events.message: test: Add sendall test for min-fee setting

events.body:
ACK cb44c5923a7c0ba15400d2b420faedd39cdce128

Applied the diff from your mutation test and checked that the test now fails and would kill the mutation.

Maybe a feature to consider for your mutation testing: Pushing a failed mutation diff to a branch somewhere. Allows to quickly cherry-pick the fix on top and test that it's fixed.

> Maybe a feature to consider for your mutation testing: Pushing a failed mutation diff to a branch somewhere. Allows to quickly cherry-pick the fix on top and test that it's fixed.

Thanks, will look into it.

comments.body: nit: this newline is not in line with PEP8

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -379,6 +385,9 @@ def run_test(self):
         # Sendall succeeds with watchonly wallets spending specific UTXOs
         self.sendall_watchonly_specific_inputs()
 
+        # Sendall fails when fee rate is lower than minimum
+        self.sendall_fails_on_low_fee()
comments.body: nit: would be more logical to put this right before/after the high fees test?

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -311,6 +311,11 @@ def sendall_watchonly_specific_inputs(self):
         assert_equal(decoded["tx"]["vin"][0]["vout"], utxo["vout"])
         assert_equal(decoded["tx"]["vout"][0]["scriptPubKey"]["address"], self.remainder_target)
 
+    @cleanup
+    def sendall_fails_on_low_fee(self):
+        assert_raises_rpc_error(-8, "Fee rate (0.999 sat/vB) is lower than the minimum fee rate setting (1.000 sat/vB)",
comments.body: every other test starts with a `self.log.info`, probably best to be consistent?

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -284,6 +284,12 @@ def sendall_fails_on_high_fee(self):
                 recipients=[self.remainder_target],
                 fee_rate=100000)
 
+    @cleanup
+    def sendall_fails_on_low_fee(self):
+        self.log.info("Test sendall fails if the transaction fee is too low")
comments.body:
nit: would prefer to be precise
```suggestion
        self.log.info("Test sendall fails if the transaction fee is lower than the minimum fee rate setting")
```

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -284,6 +284,12 @@ def sendall_fails_on_high_fee(self):
                 recipients=[self.remainder_target],
                 fee_rate=100000)
 
+    @cleanup
+    def sendall_fails_on_low_fee(self):
+        self.log.info("Test sendall fails if the transaction fee is too low")
+        assert_raises_rpc_error(-8, "Fee rate (0.999 sat/vB) is lower than the minimum fee rate setting (1.000 sat/vB)",
+        self.wallet.sendall, recipients=[self.recipient], options={"fee_rate": 0.999})
comments.body:
nit: `fee_rate` is also defined as a regular argument, so no need to use `options`
```suggestion
        self.wallet.sendall, recipients=[self.recipient], fee_rate=0.999)
```

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -284,6 +284,12 @@ def sendall_fails_on_high_fee(self):
                 recipients=[self.remainder_target],
                 fee_rate=100000)
 
+    @cleanup
+    def sendall_fails_on_low_fee(self):
+        self.log.info("Test sendall fails if the transaction fee is too low")

@@ -284,6 +284,12 @@ def sendall_fails_on_high_fee(self):
                 recipients=[self.remainder_target],
                 fee_rate=100000)
 
+    @cleanup
+    def sendall_fails_on_low_fee(self):
+        self.log.info("Test sendall fails if the transaction fee is too low")
+        assert_raises_rpc_error(-8, "Fee rate (0.999 sat/vB) is lower than the minimum fee rate setting (1.000 sat/vB)",
+        self.wallet.sendall, recipients=[self.recipient], options={"fee_rate": 0.999})
